aisha1.description: Aisha has a brand new baby boy, named Aidan. Aidan was born on Thanksgiving day.  Babies are falling from the sky!
aisha1.title: Aisha 1

aisha2.description: Felix is always shy and reserved when we go visit someone. But soon enough, he joins the fun.
aisha2.title: Aisha 2

aisha3.description: Aisha and Leila admire Felix's teddy bear socks.
aisha3.title: Aisha 3

bythebay1.description: Visiting the docks by the bay. Felix was very interested in a fisherman we met. He has been pretend-fishing since.
bythebay1.title: Bythebay 1

bythebay2.description: Lucie is exactly at the half way point in her pregnancy. Only 20 more weeks to go!
bythebay2.title: Bythebay 2

bythebay3.description: Dean explains ferries to Felix.  Felix was concerned the captain would bump the ferry too hard against the dock.
bythebay3.title: Bythebay 3

bythebay4.description: The ferry building is right next to Dean's office (the big red brick building in the back).  This was also explained to Felix, but we are afraid he got his facts all mixed up. He is now convinced that Dean's job is to keep ferry boats from bumping!  When Dean when to work yesterday, Felix said "Bye Papa.  Boat no bump!".
bythebay4.title: Bythebay 4

bythebay5.description: Justin Herman plaza, across from the ferry building.  You decide:  majestic statue, or decaying plumbing?
bythebay5.title: Bythebay 5

cooking1.description: Felix loves cooking, and he hates wearing clothes. True happiness is wearing nothing but an apron.
cooking1.title: Cooking 1

cooking2.description:
Felix cooks lunch for his stuffed animals.

Notice the little blue elephant. This is Felix's baby. He calls him "bébé elephant" and he treats him in the tenderest way. Up until today, when asked who the elephant's mom is, Felix would say "lost" in a mournful voice.

The concept of losing mom comes from the movie Babar. Babar's mom is killed, and Babar wanders for a while, all lost and alone. Felix has watched the video many many times, and we have seen him act out the losing mom scene with his toy elephants.
cooking2.title: Cooking 2

elephant.description:
This morning, the baby elephant saga took a new turn. Felix declared that HE was the elephant's mom, and he carried it under his T-shirt for hours. When a woman at the store complimented him on his cute elephant, he corrected her, saying "Bébé!" in a can't-you-see-it's-my-baby voice.

At lunch time, he finally agreed to take out his baby (too much yogurt was getting dropped on its face). He carefuly put the elephant in a sieve, wrapped in a napkin, on the floor. Several times during lunch, Felix excused himself from the table, claiming that his baby was crying. He would gently pet it for a minute or two. I asked him why his baby was crying, and he just sort of shrugged, as if to say "well, you know, that's what babies do".

For a 2-year old, he's got a remarkably realistic expectation of what life with an infant is like.
elephant.title: Elephant

fixit.description:
Another favorite pastime: fixing things. His fascination with planes, helicopters and airports continues, but he also fixes all sort of other things as well.

In the same vein, he loves playing doctor (usually as the patient)... we are supposed to inspect his body for boo-boos then "fix" them with little massages, funny noises, and an imaginary screwdriver.

Baby elephant watches him fix the helicopter.
fixit.title: Fixit

zoe1.description: This is Zoe, daughter of Justine (Lucie's sister) and Yves Bobinnec, and sister of 21-month old Iris.
zoe1.title: Zoe 1

zoe2.description: Last time we checked, there weren't any photos of Zoe on the Bobinnec family website, but we are sure there will be an update very soon.
zoe2.title: Zoe 2

description:
Zoe Bobinnec, Felix's littlest cousin, was born on March 4, 2004, in Nice, France. Both mother and child are doing great. Welcome to the world, Zoe!

For the first time this week, Dean was able to feel Bastille kick. Go Bastille!

Not wanting to be the only one on the block not getting any baby action, Felix declared himself pregnant with a baby elephant.
title: March 5
